content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Oil Extraction System at (17.5,40.5)
- **Pumpjack** at (17.5,40.5) - Extracts crude oil (299930 crude oil remaining)
- **Main Storage tank** at (21.5,41.5) - Stores crude oil (currently holding 58.7 crude oil)
- **Remote Storage tank** at (15.5,35.5) - Additional storage (currently holding 17.6 crude oil)
- Connected by underground PipeGroup (fluid_system=1420) for crude oil transport

### Power Generation System at (26.5,42.0)
- **Offshore pump** at (-11.5,21.5) - Provides water
- **Boiler** at (26.5,42.0) - Burns coal to heat water (currently has 50 coal)
- **Steam engine** at (29.5,42.5) - Generates 13500 energy from steam
- Connected by:
  - PipeGroup (fluid_system=1413) for water transport
  - PipeGroup (fluid_system=1425) for steam transport
- Powered by electricity group (id=758) with 6 small electric poles

## ERROR TIPS

### Pipe network access errors
- Verify pipe groups exist before accessing them (StopIteration/IndexError when querying fluid_system=249/689/732/777)
- Use get_entities() with proper filters and handle empty results when locating pipe groups

### Storage tank placement failures
- Multiple failed attempts to place storage tank at:
  - Right of existing tank (positions 25.5,41.5 and 27.5,41.5)
  - Left of existing tank
  - Below existing tank
  - Northwest position (18.5,38.5)
- Solutions:
  - Check for existing entities before placement attempts
  - Use larger spacing (minimum 2 tiles)
  - Consider alternative locations away from existing infrastructure
  - Verify terrain is buildable (not water)

### Power system management
- Monitor boiler fuel levels (currently 50 coal)
- Maintain backup fuel supply to prevent power interruptions
- Current power production (13500) matches consumption

### Fluid system monitoring
- Current oil production (858.5/min) exceeds target (250/min) by 343%
- Water production (182.0/min) matches steam production (182.0/min)
- Consider optimizing pumpjack operation if resource conservation is desired

### General placement
- Verify target position is clear before placing new entities
- Ensure proper spacing between entities to allow connections
- Check both surface and underground entities when evaluating placement locations

### Maintenance procedures
- Implement automated fuel monitoring and replenishment
- Establish regular inspection schedules for pipe networks
- Monitor storage tank levels to prevent overflow
- Document all network connections for troubleshooting
